meanings.definition: Make a loud, resonant sound or series of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The bell clangors loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The metal gate clangors shut with a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The pots and pans clangors together in a chaotic symphony.
meanings.sent4: His words clangors in her mind, echoing long after he left.
meanings.sent5: The thunder clangors through the valley, shaking the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or series of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The clangors of construction work filled the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The clangors of the train passing by could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The clangors of the wind chimes created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent4: The clangors of the battle echoed across the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The clangors of the church bells signaled the start of the ceremony.
